remarks: Once the Stone Weierstrass theorem has been proven for approximating nonnegative functions, then this lemma is used to extend the result to functions with (possibly) negative values.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem21.1 $e |- F/_ t G $.
stoweidlem21.2 $e |- F/_ t H $.
stoweidlem21.3 $e |- F/_ t S $.
stoweidlem21.4 $e |- F/ t ph $.
stoweidlem21.5 $e |- G = ( t e. T |-> ( ( H ` t ) + S ) ) $.
stoweidlem21.6 $e |- ( ph -> F : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem21.7 $e |- ( ph -> S e. RR ) $.
stoweidlem21.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) + ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem21.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. RR ) -> ( t e. T |-> x ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem21.10 $e |- ( ph -> A. f e. A f : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem21.11 $e |- ( ph -> H e. A ) $.
stoweidlem21.12 $e |- ( ph -> A. t e. T ( abs ` ( ( H ` t ) - ( ( F ` t ) - S ) ) ) < E ) $.
stoweidlem21 $p |- ( ph -> E. f e. A A. t e. T ( abs ` ( ( f ` t ) - ( F ` t ) ) ) < E ) $.
